results.title: Out of the blue
results.creator_credit: Leigh Jason, Isadore G. Goldsmith, Pathe Industries and Eagle-Lion
results.brief_description: Hen pecked Arthur Earthliegh (George Brent) has a respite from one woman - his wife, only to end up in the arms of another, the drunken yet voracious Olive (Ann Dvorak) who accompanies him home one night. Unbeknownst to Arthur, Olive has a heart condition and Arthur, thinking he has killed her, places the body on the next door neighbour’s patio - all under the watchful eye of 2 elderly female residents who alert the police. By the time the police have arrived, next door neighbour David has decided to extort Earthliegh into helping him dispose of the body in exchange for Earthliegh dropping the case against having David and his dog, Rabelais (who is prone to digging up the Earthliegh’s zinnias) evicted. Cast also includes Carole Landis and Turhan Bey. Based on a story by Vera Caspary.

results.title: Out of slavery: 1619-1860
results.creator_credit: Alvin Yudkoff, Milton Meltzer and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Effective use of illustrations and still photographs, coupled with powerful music, to describe the period from the beginning of the slave trade with Africa to the election of Abraham Lincoln. Deals with the role of the War of Independence and the Declaration of Independence in the abolition of slavery. Also the growth of the southern cotton industry, underground railway, and northern abolitionists. Narrated by James Earl Jones. Suitable for upper primary and secondary school levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alvin Yudkoff, Milton Meltzer and McGraw-Hill Films

results.title: Out of Sight Out of Mind [Part 1]
results.creator_credit: David Goldie and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Part One (only) of the four-part series ‘Out of Sight, Out of Mind’.

This documentary, made for the ABC in 1987, helped to raise awareness about a much neglected section of our society. It provided extensive insight into the prison system, interviewing prisoners, prison officers and administrators.

The full work has four parts titled ‘Locked Up’, ‘Surviving in the Nick’, ‘The Keepers and the Kept’, and ‘The Cycle of Crime’. This program pulls no punches, describes the conditions of various correctional institutions around Australia and also offers some suggestions for improvements.

results.title: Out of sight [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Steven Soderbergh, Stacey Sher, Michael Shamberg, Danny DeVito and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Directed by Steven Soderbergh, ‘Out of Sight’ has been adapted from the novel of the same name by Elmore Leonard. When Jack Foley (George Clooney) robs a bank, his car breaks down and he is sent to a Florida prison. His escape attempt is witnessed by Federal Marshall Karen Sisco (Jennifer Lopez) who, as a result, is kidnapped by Foley’s partner, Buddy Bragg (Ving Rhames). Despite being on opposite sides of the law, Foley and Sisco discover their attraction to each other and Sisco is faced with a moral dilemma as she questions whether or not to turn him in.

results.title: 20 Things to make and do = 20 fun things to make and do
results.creator_credit: Rob Sheerlock, Ian Richardson, Graham Peach, John Harry, James Lingwood, NWS Channel 9 (Adelaide, S. Aust.) and Science Craft
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Deane and Rob’s Curiosity Show collection”.
Deane Hutton and Rob Morrison from “The Curiosity Show” present twenty of their favourite activities. By following the step-by-step instructions viewers can make twenty different toys and games, using materials readily available around the house.

results.title: Dealing with drought
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows how some farmers and graziers managed their properties to cope with drought conditions in various parts of Queensland and New South Wales between 1964 and 1967. Shows how the problem can be met successfully in several ways to minimise its effects including hand feeding, reducing stock, and use of underground water. Emphasises the importance of adopting a definite plan to provide for the bad years and changing circumstances.

results.title: Dead ringers
results.creator_credit: David Cronenberg, Mark Boyman and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description: Jeremy Irons plays the dual role of Elliott and Beverley Mantle, two genius twin gynaecologists. The twins share all aspects of their lives, including their work, sexual partners and social circle. When one of them falls in love, this creates a disturbance in both of their psychologies which is horribly acted out in their medical experimentation on women. David Cronenberg has directed some of modern cinema’s most effective horror films but “Dead Ringers” is possibly his masterpiece being a terrifying nightmare that examines the monsters in our own psyches. A startling, disturbing film that confronts the male and female viewer with our basest fears of misogyny, birth and sexuality. Co-starring Genevieve Bujold and based on the book “Twins” by Bari Wood and Jack Geasland.
